verses.text: By night on my bed I sought \add him\add* whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.
I will rise now, and go about the city In the streets and in the broad ways, I will seek \add him\add* whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.
The watchmen that go about the city found me: \add To whom I said\add*, Saw ye \add him\add* whom my soul loveth?

\add It was\add* but a little that I passed from them, But I found \add him\add* whom my soul loveth: I held him, and would not let him go, Until I had brought him into my mother’s house, And into the chamber of her that conceived me.
I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, By the roes, and by the hinds of the field, That ye stir not up, nor awake \add my\add* love, till he please.
Who \add is\add* this that cometh out of the wilderness like pillars of smoke, Perfumed \add with\add* myrrh and frankincense, With all powders of the merchant?
Behold his bed, which \add is\add* Solomon’s; Threescore valiant \add men are\add* about it, Of the valiant of Israel.
They all hold swords, \add being\add* expert in war: Every man \add hath\add* his sword upon his thigh because of fear in the night.
King Solomon made himself a chariot of the wood of Lebanon.

He made the pillars thereof \add of\add* silver, The bottom thereof \add of\add* gold, The covering of it \add of\add* purple, The midst thereof being paved \add with\add* love, for the daughters of Jerusalem.
Go forth, O ye daughters of Zion, and behold king Solomon With the crown where\add with\add* his mother crowned him In the day of his espousals, And in the day of the gladness of his heart.
